chefs.name: Sanjeev Kapoor
chefs.bio: Sanjeev Kapoor is an Indian celebrity chef, entrepreneur, and television personality. He is widely known for his cooking show 'Khana Khazana', which is the longest-running show of its kind in Asia.
chefs.description: Sanjeev Kapoor is a renowned chef and has authored several cookbooks. He has also served as a judge on the popular cooking competition show 'MasterChef India'.

recipes.name: Butter Chicken
recipes.description: Butter chicken is a popular Indian dish made with marinated chicken cooked in a tomato-based sauce with spices and cream.
instructions: Marinate the chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and cumin powder. Let it rest for at least 1 hour.
In a pan, melt butter and add tomato puree. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the puree thickens.
Add marinated chicken to the pan and cook for 10-15 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
Add cream and salt to taste. Cook for 2-3 minutes and serve hot.

recipes.name: Palak Paneer
recipes.description: Palak paneer is a vegetarian Indian dish made with spinach and cottage cheese.
instructions: Blanch the spinach in boiling water for 2-3 minutes. Drain and cool.
Grind the spinach to a smooth paste and set aside.
In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds. When they start to splutter, add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft.
Add red chili powder, garam masala, and salt to taste. Cook for a minute.
Add the spinach paste and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Cut the paneer into small cubes and add it to the pan. Cook for a minute and serve hot.

chefs.description: Vikas Khanna is the executive chef of Junoon, a restaurant in New York City, and the author of several cookbooks including 'The Flavors of Spice' and 'My Great India Cookbook'. He has also served as the official chef for the President of India at the Rashtrapati Bhavan.

chefs.name: Tarla Dalal
chefs.bio: Tarla Dalal was an Indian chef and cookbook author who specialized in vegetarian cuisine. She wrote more than 100 cookbooks and hosted several cooking shows on television.
chefs.description: Tarla Dalal was known for her simple and easy-to-follow recipes that emphasized healthy eating. Her recipes were popular among both vegetarians and non-vegetarians.

recipes.name: Aloo Gobi
recipes.description: Aloo gobi is a vegetarian Indian dish made with potatoes and cauliflower.
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. When they start to splutter, add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder. Cook for a minute.
Add cubed potatoes and cauliflower florets. Mix well.
Add salt to taste and 1/2 cup of water. Mix well.
Cover and cook for 10-15 minutes until the vegetables are cooked through.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

chefs.name: Ranveer Brar
chefs.bio: Ranveer Brar is an Indian celebrity chef and restaurateur. He has hosted several TV shows and is known for his expertise in Indian and fusion cuisine.
chefs.description: Ranveer Brar has worked in various kitchens around the world, including Michelin-starred restaurants in Europe. He owns several restaurants in India and is also an author of multiple cookbooks.

recipes.name: Lobster Butter Masala
recipes.description: Lobster butter masala is a seafood version of the popular butter chicken dish. The lobster is cooked in a creamy tomato-based sauce with spices and butter.
ingredients: 1 lb lobster meat, cooked and shelled
instructions: In a pan, melt butter and add ginger-garlic paste. Cook for a minute.
Add tomato puree and cook for 5-7 minutes until the puree thickens.
Add red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and cumin powder. Cook for a minute.
Add cooked lobster meat and salt to taste. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add cream and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Mutton Rogan Josh
recipes.description: Mutton rogan josh is a Kashmiri dish made with lamb or mutton cooked in a spicy tomato-based gravy.
instructions: In a pressure cooker, heat oil and add chopped onions. Cook until the onions turn golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft.
Add red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and cumin powder. Cook for a minute.
Add mutton or lamb and salt to taste. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add yogurt and enough water to cover the meat. Close the pressure cooker and cook for 15-20 minutes or until the meat is tender.
Serve hot with rice or naan.

chefs.name: Madhur Jaffrey
chefs.bio: Madhur Jaffrey is an Indian-born actress, food and travel writer, and television personality. She is known for bringing Indian cuisine to the western world through her cookbooks and television shows.
chefs.description: Madhur Jaffrey has authored several cookbooks and has been awarded numerous culinary awards. She has also appeared in several films and television shows, both in India and abroad.

recipes.name: Chicken Korma
recipes.description: Chicken korma is a rich, creamy Indian dish made with marinated chicken cooked in a fragrant sauce with yogurt, cream, and spices.
instructions: Marinate the chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and cumin powder. Let it rest for at least 1 hour.
In a pan, heat ghee and add chopped onions. Sauté until they turn golden brown.
Add tomato puree and cook for 5-7 minutes until the puree thickens.
Add marinated chicken to the pan and cook for 10-15 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
Add cream and salt to taste. Cook for 2-3 minutes and serve hot.

recipes.name: Masoor Dal
recipes.description: Masoor dal is a simple and delicious Indian dish made with red lentils and flavored with spices and herbs.
instructions: Wash the masoor dal and soak it in water for 30 minutes.

In a pressure cooker, add the soaked dal, water, chopped onions, chopped tomatoes, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt to taste. Pressure cook for 3-4 whistles or until the dal is cooked through.
In a pan, heat ghee and add minced garlic. Cook for a minute.
Add garam masala and cook for another minute.
Add the cooked dal to the pan and mix well.
Cook for 2-3 minutes and serve hot with rice or bread.

chefs.name: Gaggan Anand
chefs.bio: Gaggan Anand is a highly acclaimed Indian chef who is known for his modernist approach to Indian cuisine. He is the owner and chef of Gaggan, a restaurant in Bangkok, Thailand, which has been ranked as the best restaurant in Asia on multiple occasions.
chefs.description: Gaggan Anand has won numerous awards for his innovative and boundary-pushing approach to Indian cuisine. He draws inspiration from his Indian heritage and combines it with modern techniques to create dishes that are both visually stunning and incredibly flavorful.

recipes.name: Spherified Olives
recipes.description: Spherified olives are a signature dish at Gaggan. The dish consists of small olives that have been turned into small, liquid-filled spheres using a technique called spherification.
instructions: Make a solution of water and sodium alginate. Mix well and let it rest for 30 minutes.
Purée the green olives and add them to the solution. Mix well.
Fill a syringe with the olive mixture.
Make a solution of water and calcium chloride.
Slowly release the olive mixture from the syringe into the calcium chloride solution. The olive mixture will form small, liquid-filled spheres.
Let the spheres rest in the calcium chloride solution for 3-4 minutes. Rinse with water and serve.

recipes.name: Yoghurt Explosion
recipes.description: Yoghurt explosion is another signature dish at Gaggan. The dish consists of a small, thin-skinned sphere filled with yoghurt, which explodes in the mouth when eaten.
instructions: Make a solution of water and sodium alginate. Mix well and let it rest for 30 minutes.
Mix the yoghurt, sugar, and rose water in a bowl.
Fill a syringe with the yoghurt mixture.
Make a solution of water and calcium chloride.
Slowly release the yoghurt mixture from the syringe into the calcium chloride solution. The yoghurt mixture will form small, thin-skinned spheres.
Let the spheres rest in the calcium chloride solution for 3-4 minutes. Rinse with water and serve.
